alert.note: Alert for Knox (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 4:26PM CDT until June 25 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... Ponca Creek At Verdel affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ponca Creek At Verdel. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, At this level Rayder Swanson Road floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.3 feet...or 0.2 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 13.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 06/06/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 730 AM CDT.
